clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.notes:
The Government need to prove that the temperature is warming before they waste our money. Where does this money go. What has

 it been spent on. The science isn't settled. Has anyone taken the time to review all the predictions from the last 10 - 15 years to
 prove that these predictions have occurred?

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
clauses.notes:
Focus on cleaning our rivers and beaches. Spend the money improving our cities infrastructure. sewerage systems. I'm am all for

 sustainability.

clauses.question: 3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
4. Should the Zero Carbon Bill allow the 2050 target to be revised if circumstances change?
clauses.notes: As more studies indicate the system is a wrought to control the population and tax for the benefit of few.

clauses.question: 5. The Government proposes that three emissions budgets of five years each (i.e. covering the next 15 years) be in place at any given time. Do you agree with this proposal?
clauses.notes: Prove that this wrought is justified.

clauses.question: 6. Should the Government be able to alter the last emissions budget (i.e. furthest into the future)?
clauses.answer: Yes - each incoming Government should have the option to review the third budget in the sequence

clauses.question: 7. Should the Government have the ability to review and adjust the second emissions budget within a specific range under exceptional circumstances? See p36 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: Prove that this wrought is justified

clauses.question: 8. Do you agree with the considerations we propose that the Government and the Climate Change Commission take into account when advising on and setting budgets? See p44 Our Climate Your Say
9. Should the Zero Carbon Bill require Governments to set out plans within a certain timeframe to achieve the emissions budgets?
10. What are the most important issues for the Government to consider in setting plans to meet budgets? For example, who do we need to work with, what else needs to be considered?
clauses.notes:
Forget Climate change (Since global warming has been changed because its a wrought) Just spend the money cleaning up the

countries rivers and encourage people not to litter and take pride in our country.

clauses.question: 11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
13. The Government has proposed that Climate Change Commissioners need to have a range of essential and desirable expertise. Do you agree with the proposed expertise? See p45 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
Most experts seem to be corrupt these days. They are not held to account and the whole process is designed for some people to
make money.

clauses.question: 14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes:
We have been repeatedly indoctrinated on this. (when I was at school we were heading into a cooling period) Then we were warned
we were all going to fry! Now it is climate change. Its a wrought!!!
